page.title: 12FARMING
page.content: The farming pattern in the area is very mixed depending on soil, landslope and current farming trends.Good crops of barley, turnips and potatoes are grown as food or cash crops but with the main crop being grass either as silage,stored fresh grass or hay for use as cattle food in the winter. The main produce is milk which is collected by tanker and taken to the Express Dairy at Appleby.Next comes the rearing of fat cattle and sheep for meat.These are sold at local auction marts. The main breeds are: dairy cattle_Friesian,beef cattle_ Friesian crossed with Hereford,Simental or Charlois.Sheep breeds are Cheviot,Greyface,Blackface with cross breeds of many sorts.A great recent change is the decline in haymaking with a great swing to silage
